Reviews.Title: LG Double Play Android 4G Cell Phone.
Reviews.Author: Brus V
Reviews.Content: LG Double Play:  We really love this phone!  First and foremost, it's 4G.  My last smart phone was 3G.  3G is good, but 4G just soars.  It's like driving a gas guzzler, and then getting a Tesla Sportster.  You can compare them, but it not fair to the former.*Texting:  The slide out full Qwerty keybd works even with my large fingers.  On my previous phone, I was always having to be careful when I texted.  I would often hit the key next to the one I wanted, or have to hit a key 5 times before it would register.  The Double Play kybd has really good spacing is raised just enough to make typing fun again.  When you don't have to constantly stop to correct typing errors, you can type really fast.*Camera:  I take a lot of pictures.  The camera on Double Play is fantastic.  It's auto focus function really improves every picture I take.  In a lot of ways, it's better than a regular camera, since its small, always with me, and the results are spectacular.*Email:  You can easily set up your desk top email accounts like Gmail, Yahoo, and MSN.  I have several POP email accounts, and it took minutes to set them all up.  Now, everything that downloads to my desktop, also downloads to my phone.*Ease of USE:  On the top left of the phones display, there is an area that tells you, you have emails, messages, calendar reminders, etc.  When ever you see an icon in this area, you use your finger, and swype down a shade, and you get a prompt telling you:  you missed a call (touch this, and it gives you detail on the missed call, i.e. who called, the number, etc), you have a voicemail, a calendar reminder, etc.  On the base of the large display, you have preset buttons to take the display to the "Home" screen, a "Back" or go to last screen button, a "Search" buttong, and a "Menu" button.  In any screen depressing the "menu" button gives you set up and running options for the screen you are in.*CMAS:  The phone is equipped with the national and local emergency warnings  The phone will give you a message alert when there is bad weather, all the way up to Presidential emergency alerts.  Last night, the phone started sounding the emergency alert tone.  It was an alert about severe weather in our area.  Great to always have this option with us where ever we are.*WiFi:  You can use your home computers wireless system, and/or your local coffee shops, and/or local stores to make calls.  Two benefits, first, it insures reception in hard to get a signal places and second, can depending on your plan, not impact your phones plan minutes.*Battery Life:  My last smart phone, had to be charged at least 1x a day,  If I spent a couple hours surfing, I would have to throw it on the charger immediately.  With the Double Play, I am able to all that I want, surf, call, text, and at the end of the day, I may or maybe not, have to charge the phone.*Multiple Displays:  You get 2 displays on this phone.  Embedded in the slide out qwerty kybd, is a second smaller display.  I keep my "today's" calendar displayed on this display, and do every else on the main display.  You can set up the second display for weather, news, or whatever you want.  It has an icon driven menu system, and you can leave it in the home display, and ready to run what you want, when you want.You can use this second display to read email as you scroll through the email list on the large display.*Optional Carrying Case:  Amazon has some custom hard plastic cases for under 15 bucks.  Actually, you get five different colors, black, red, blue,  and white for $12.74.*Optional Memory:  The phone comes with a 2GB micro SD card.  I swapped this out for a 32 GB micro SD card.  Amazon sells these typically for 20 to 25 dollars.Summary:  Overall, I have had a lot of phones, and this by far is my favorite!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Nicky
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome phone with plenty of storage. The battery charges fast. Absolutely no complaints! The phone shipped fast and there were no problems with using a sim from straighttalk.

Reviews.Title: laggy
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: it is great but has a old phone lag to it and can freeze sometimes with the a button not functioning properly but other than that a great unique design and  handy when working on online and chatting.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Phone
Reviews.Author: SunnyvaleSarah
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to use with SimpleMobile and it works. It is faster than my unsupported Droid X on their network and  it wasn't too hard setting it up to run on their mobile network either. I did have to hunt down the drivers online to install on my computer so I could transfer music and such onto the phone, but once I did that, no problems. I wanted a real keyboard and I haven't had too many problems getting used to the split keyboard design. I only wish there was a "shift" key on both sides of the keyboard, but this is a minor complaint. I've already dropped the phone a few times without ill consequences too. The calls are clear, it is easy to use and the camera has done a good job. I recommend this phone to anyone wanting a snappy phone that they can use on SImpleMobile. I save a TON of money not being tied to some contract and this phone does everything I want and need it to do.

Reviews.Title: Super phone
Reviews.Author: Brightsunshine
Reviews.Content: I recommend the seller due to their professional and prompt customer service and the quality of the product. The seller was very courteous when contacted.  This is a nice inexpensive 4G phone. I would recommend this phone to anyone that writes a lot of emails or text messages.  It was packaged so nicely I wasn't sure whether they sent me the right product!  I received the phone very timely.  I couldn't believe it was so attractively priced.  You don't get any extras only the basics for this price, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone for the price, but....
Reviews.Author: William B. Ahart Jr.
Reviews.Content: Both myself and my GF are on simple mobile. Stuck the sim card in, and was blazing along at 4G speeds. It's fast, and simple to use. If you are on simple mobile and looking for a great, cheap 4G phone. Get this phone.. Ok here is the but... The "programming instructions" from simple mobile's site says to delete the apn from T-Mobile and enter in their stuff.  The apn from T-Mobile cannot be removed.  This is why I have my doubts it's unlocked.  I do not have a sim from another service so I cannot test this theory.  This is why only four stars.  In the end, it seems not to make a difference, but would like to know why it cannot be removed. In the end, I think this phone is awesome.  If I would have seen this before I got my exhibit II, I would have gotten this phone...

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Carol Rozier
Reviews.Content: Very affordable for the price it was just waiting on me to find it.  I did not think I was going to ever get a good price on a new phone but it pays to keep checking.  Love this phone!

Reviews.Title: Buy it
Reviews.Author: kari kuykendoll
Reviews.Content: T-Mobile doesnt sell this phone anymore and I dont know why because this is a great phone. My brother bought his phone a few months ago from T-Mobile for 450 dollars and when I seen this one on Amazon I had to have it.

Reviews.Title: awesome phone
Reviews.Author: stefanie crites
Reviews.Content: Great features dependable fast sturdy and super cool with the double screen any mom would love this you can talk notes on small screen while talking

Reviews.Title: Modest phone for modest price.
Reviews.Author: Charles J.
Reviews.Content: After a little research, I decided to get this phone to upgrade from my old phone. It's not too bad for its price... But you can expect a few hiccups here and there. My biggest problem is that it seems to allow apps to use a lot of memory. This can easily be fixed with a task killer or memory booster.I haven't really found any use for the slide-out keyboard, but it's pretty nifty to have.Also: it won't work with unlimited data on GoPhone's $50 plan. And speeds are only Edge/2G. That's why I'll be switching to T-Mobile's $30 prepaid plan.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Eva-Bks
Reviews.Content: This is my phone for now, a little bit heavy but servers its purpose. I like the fact that it has both keyboard function and touchscreen

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: gerardo leal
Reviews.Content: I ordered this phone and it got delivered on time and with everything they said. I had no problem installing the Sim card. It worked perfectly with tmobile.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Seller!!!
Reviews.Author: Peggy B
Reviews.Content: My son did not do very thorough research---we loved the phone, but it is not compatible with our plan.  Seller answered all my questions and concerns quickly; we tried to find a way to make this work!  When it did not, the return and refund could not have been any easier!!  If I ever need something they have, I can guarantee him my business!!!  AAA+++

Reviews.Title: A bit clunky but I'm able to browse the web without weird distorted pages.
Reviews.Author: ANIMAL~Lover "MG"
Reviews.Content: A bit clunky and the second screen is too small to really use but it is an Android phone and I'm able to browse the web without weird distorted pages.

Reviews.Title: Works great for 2 months, then breaks.
Reviews.Author: Joe Shortino
Reviews.Content: I got this phone in April and it lasted until the beginning of June. It kept rejecting the SIM Card and now i can't use it at all. Great for the first 2 months and thats it. Save yourself some money and do not buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: It is very strong and works great! This phone is very useful for my needs. I think anyone who needs a tough smart phone should look into this one.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: My review of what I ordered
Reviews.Content: Nice phone. Purchased for my daughter. The phone was recieved via UPS very quickly and the packaging all in tact.  It is well built.  Heavy, but we like that.  Android 2.3.  The problem with was it was on the charger for a few hours and wasn't charging.  I turned off the phone and turned it on again.  This seemed to rectify the problem.  My daughter loves it.

Reviews.Title: phone
Reviews.Author: missk
Reviews.Content: the phone is ok it has its moments where it shuts down by its self and the signal goes out screen freeze's up

Reviews.Title: I wish I never brought it
Reviews.Author: chell
Reviews.Content: I thought the LG DoublePlay 4G looked cool and depsite some reviews I've read I still brought. The phone is heavy, the bottom screen is only useful for texting or changing songs, the buttons don't always work when u press it, and the browser constantly force closes.#Don't Buy

Reviews.Author: Denise Atilano
Reviews.Content: the phone is nice but its to slow at times and the picture messages don't always go outalso calls are always dropped its pretty bad. i read many reviews about it and ignored themnow i regret not listening to them
